definition: to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The refusal of the actor turned all our arrangements for the performance topsy-turvy.
sentences.chinese: 那個演員拒絕出臺把我們整個演出安排都搞亂了。

sentences.english: It's such a neat room. We'd better not mess anything up.
sentences.chinese: 這房間真是整潔，我們最好不要把東西搞亂了。

sentences.english: The system munged my whole week's work.
sentences.chinese: 這個系統把我一整週的工作都搞亂了。

sentences.english: She jumbles the words when she is supposed to write a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 將要寫句子的時候，她搞亂了字詞的次序。

sentences.english: The bank has been messing my account about again.
sentences.chinese: 這家銀行又把我的賬搞亂了。

sentences.english: But the digital trail is littered with intriguing bits of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 但是數字尾跡被有興趣查證的碎片搞亂了。

sentences.english: My son disarranged the papers on my desk.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子把我桌子上的紙張搞亂了。

sentences.english: Because it confuses the model and adds very little useful information. Compare the three models in Figure 1
sentences.chinese: 因爲它搞亂了模型，只增加了很少的有用信息。

sentences.english: The labor Party snarled up the opposition in an election.
sentences.chinese: 勞工黨工競選中搞亂了反對黨陣線。

sentences.english: Our system of appetite control is completely unpicked by the junk food diet.
sentences.chinese: 我們的食慾控制系統完全被垃圾食品搞亂了。

sentences.english: It worked well for me but If you mess up you have to cast a new faceplate .
sentences.chinese: 它運作良好，對我，但如果你搞亂你投一個新的面板。

sentences.english: This look just screams spring and is almost impossible to mess up.
sentences.chinese: 這看起來就像在春天尖叫，幾乎是不可能搞亂的。

sentences.english: If you have messed up relationships, you are a pushover for Satan.
sentences.chinese: 如果你搞亂了關係，你是撒旦容易擊敗的人。

sentences.english: Our travel arrangements have been messed up by the ticket office.
sentences.chinese: 我們的旅行安排被售票處搞亂了。

sentences.english: When speculators confuse the market, none will make money.
sentences.chinese: 投機者把市場搞亂了，誰也賺不了錢。
